info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:20PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lewis and Clark, northwestern Meagher, northern Judith Basin, west central Fergus and southeastern Cascade Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 319 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Stanford to 20 miles south of Belt to 15 miles south of Cascade. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stanford, Denton, Geyser, Neihart, Raynesford, Monarch, Sluice Boxes State Park and Eden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
